name: St. Chad

locations.description: Bishop of Mercia and Lindsey, later Bishop of Lichfield

summary: Chad was an Anglo-Saxon bishop who played a key role in the Christianization of England. He was the first Bishop of Mercia and Lindsey, and later became Bishop of Lichfield. He was a disciple of St. Aidan and was known for his humility, his devotion to prayer, and his missionary work. He is the patron saint of Lichfield Cathedral.
